article:
'Repossession' is generally used to refer to a financial institution taking back
an object that was either used as collateral or rented or leased in a
transaction. Repossession is a "self-help" type of action in which the party
having right of ownership of the property in question takes the property back
from the party having right of possession without invoking court proceedings.
The property is then sold on by either the financial institution or 3rd party
sellers. The extent to which repossession is authorized, and how it may be
executed, greatly varies in different jurisdictions (see below).
